name: Lost at the MGC 2023
description:
A sequel to the ill fated Lost at the MGC 2020 series (due to the cancellation of the Midwest Gaming Classic in 2020 because of COVID) a new generation of mini games have been created for the original Game Boy. Six games on six cartridges hidden around the Midwest Gaming Classic. Can you find them, or will they forever be Lost at the MGC?

A number of sets of the carts were hidden [ARE to be hidden, the MGC hasn't occurred this year as of this writing] around the convention, each with a very small mini game that would reveal a website, a password, and a number that were all important to beating the game as a whole. (Then one could sit back, relax, and watch the awful credits.)

I'll be updating this page with notes, alternative art assets and game titles, as well as assets for games that were not made for this year's set.

Random Factoids:

Middle Aged Man was originally named "The Pillow of Doom."

Madness Maze was made in an attempt to get away from doing a second platformer. Originally there were going to be two games of each type: top down, first person, and platformer.
